frustration.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
frustration.effect_short: Power increases as happiness decreases, up to a maximum of 102.
frustration.name: Frustration

fury-attack.description:
The target is jabbed repeatedly with a
horn or beak two to five times in a row.
fury-attack.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
fury-attack.name: Fury Attack

fury-cutter.description:
The target is slashed with scythes or
claws. This attack becomes more powerful
if it hits in succession.
fury-cutter.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power doubles after every time this move is used, whether consecutively or not, maxing out at 16x.  If this move misses or the user leaves the field, power resets.
fury-cutter.effect_short: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, maxing out after five turns.
fury-cutter.name: Fury Cutter

fury-swipes.description:
The target is raked with sharp claws or
scythes quickly two to five times in a row.
fury-swipes.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
fury-swipes.name: Fury Swipes

fusion-bolt.description:
The user throws down a giant thunderbolt.
This move is more powerful when
influenced by an enormous flame.
fusion-bolt.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon used fusion-flare earlier this turn, this move has double power.
fusion-bolt.effect_short: With Fusion Flare, inflicts double damage.
fusion-bolt.name: Fusion Bolt

fusion-flare.description:
The user brings down a giant flame.
This move is more powerful when
influenced by an enormous thunderbolt.
fusion-flare.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon used fusion-bolt earlier this turn, this move has double power.
fusion-flare.effect_short: With Fusion Bolt, inflicts double damage.
fusion-flare.name: Fusion Flare

future-sight.description:
Two turns after this move is used,
a hunk of psychic energy
attacks the target.
future-sight.effect_long:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder-guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus-sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
future-sight.effect_short: Hits the target two turns later.
future-sight.name: Future Sight

gastro-acid.description:
The user hurls up its stomach acids on
the target. The fluid eliminates the effect
of the target’s Ability.
gastro-acid.effect_long:
The target's ability is disabled as long as it remains on the field.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
gastro-acid.effect_short: Nullifies target's ability until it leaves battle.
gastro-acid.name: Gastro Acid

gear-grind.description:
The user attacks by throwing
steel gears at its target twice.
gear-grind.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in one turn.
gear-grind.name: Gear Grind

geomancy.description:
The user absorbs energy and sharply raises
its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats
on the next turn.
geomancy.effect_long: Takes one turn to charge, then raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by two stages.
geomancy.effect_short: Takes one turn to charge, then raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by two stages.
geomancy.name: Geomancy

giga-drain.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s
HP is restored by half the damage
taken by the target.
giga-drain.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
giga-drain.effect_short: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
giga-drain.name: Giga Drain

giga-impact.description:
The user charges at the target using
every bit of its power.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
giga-impact.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
giga-impact.effect_short: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
giga-impact.name: Giga Impact

glaciate.description:
The user attacks by blowing freezing
cold air at opposing Pokémon.
This lowers their Speed stat.
glaciate.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
glaciate.effect_short: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
glaciate.name: Glaciate

glare.description:
The user intimidates the target with the
pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.
glare.name: Glare

grass-knot.description:
The user snares the target with grass and
trips it. The heavier the target,
the greater the move’s power.
grass-knot.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120
grass-knot.effect_short: Inflicts more damage to heavier targets, with a maximum of 120 power.
grass-knot.name: Grass Knot

grass-pledge.description:
A column of grass hits the target. When used with
its water equivalent, its damage increases and
a vast swamp appears.
grass-pledge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon used fire-pledge earlier this turn, all opposing Pokémon will take 1/8 their max HP in damage at the end of every turn for four turns (including this one).
grass-pledge.effect_short: With Fire Pledge, damages opposing Pokémon for 1/8 their max HP every turn for four turns.
grass-pledge.name: Grass Pledge

grass-whistle.description:
The user plays a pleasant melody that
lulls the target into a deep sleep.
grass-whistle.name: Grass Whistle

grassy-terrain.description:
The user turns the ground under everyone’s feet
to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of
Pokémon on the ground a little every turn.
grassy-terrain.effect_long:
For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 their max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.

Changes nature-power to energy-ball.
grassy-terrain.effect_short: For five turns, heals all Pokémon on the ground for 1/16 max HP each turn and strengthens their grass moves to 1.5× their power.
grassy-terrain.name: Grassy Terrain

gravity.description:
Gravity is intensified for five turns,
making moves involving flying unusable
and negating Levitate.
gravity.effect_long:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky-drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet-rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena-trap, spikes, or toxic-spikes.

bounce, fly, sky-drop, high-jump-kick, jump-kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky-drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.
gravity.effect_short: Disables moves and immunities that involve flying or levitating for five turns.
gravity.name: Gravity

growl.description:
The user growls in an endearing way,
making opposing Pokémon less wary.
This lowers their Attack stats.
growl.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
growl.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
growl.name: Growl

growth.description:
The user’s body grows all at once,
raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
growth.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.  During sunny-day, raises both stats by two stages.
growth.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage.
growth.name: Growth

grudge.description:
If the user faints, the user’s grudge
fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s
move that knocked it out.
grudge.effect_long: If the user faints before it next acts, the move that fainted it will have its PP dropped to 0.  End-of-turn damage does not trigger this effect.
grudge.effect_short: If the user faints this turn, the PP of the move that fainted it drops to 0.
grudge.name: Grudge

guard-split.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
average its Defense and Sp. Def stats
with those of the target.
guard-split.effect_long: Averages the user's unmodified Defense with the target's unmodified Defense; the value becomes the unmodified Defense for both Pokémon. Unmodified Special Defense is averaged the same way.
guard-split.effect_short: Averages Defense and Special Defense with the target.
guard-split.name: Guard Split

guard-swap.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
switch changes to its Defense and
Sp. Def stats with the target.
guard-swap.effect_long: User swaps its Defense and Special Defense modifiers with the target.
guard-swap.effect_short: User swaps Defense and Special Defense changes with the target.
guard-swap.name: Guard Swap

guillotine.description:
A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers.
The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
guillotine.effect_long:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
guillotine.name: Guillotine

gunk-shot.description:
The user shoots filthy garbage
at the target to attack.
This may also poison the target.
gunk-shot.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
gunk-shot.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
gunk-shot.name: Gunk Shot

gust.description:
A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and
launched at the target to inflict damage.
gust.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.
gust.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage and can hit Pokémon in the air.
gust.name: Gust

gyro-ball.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed
spin. The slower the user compared to the
target, the greater the move’s power.
gyro-ball.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.
gyro-ball.effect_short: Power raises when the user has lower Speed, up to a maximum of 150.
gyro-ball.name: Gyro Ball

hail.description:
The user summons a hailstorm lasting five
turns. It damages all Pokémon except the
Ice type.
hail.effect_long:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow-cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.
hail.effect_short: Changes the weather to a hailstorm for five turns.
hail.name: Hail

hammer-arm.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong
and heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
hammer-arm.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.
hammer-arm.effect_short: Lowers user's Speed by one stage.
hammer-arm.name: Hammer Arm

happy-hour.description:
Using Happy Hour doubles
the amount of prize money
received after battle.
happy-hour.effect_long:
Doubles prize money.

Stacks with a held item.  Only works once per battle.
happy-hour.name: Happy Hour

harden.description:
The user stiffens all the muscles in its
body to raise its Defense stat.
harden.effect_long: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.
harden.effect_short: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.
harden.name: Harden

haze.description:
The user creates a haze that eliminates
every stat change among all the Pokémon
engaged in battle.
haze.effect_long:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear-body or white-smoke.
haze.effect_short: Resets all Pokémon's stats, accuracy, and evasion.
haze.name: Haze

head-charge.description:
The user charges its head into its
target, using its powerful guard hair.
This also damages the user a little.
head-charge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
head-charge.effect_short: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
head-charge.name: Head Charge

head-smash.description:
The user attacks the target with a
hazardous, full-power headbutt.
This also damages the user terribly.
head-smash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
head-smash.effect_short: User receives 1/2 the damage inflicted in recoil.
head-smash.name: Head Smash

headbutt.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks
by charging straight into the target.
This may also make the target flinch.
headbutt.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
headbutt.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
headbutt.name: Headbutt

heal-bell.description:
The user makes a soothing bell chime
to heal the status conditions of all the
party Pokémon.
heal-bell.effect_long: Removes major status effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user's party.
heal-bell.effect_short: Cures the entire party of major status effects.
heal-bell.name: Heal Bell

heal-block.description:
For five turns, the user prevents the
opposing team from using any moves,
Abilities, or held items that recover HP.
heal-block.effect_long: For the next five turns, the target may not use any moves that only restore HP, and move effects that heal the target are disabled.  Moves that steal HP may still be used, but will only inflict damage and not heal the target.
heal-block.effect_short: Prevents target from restoring its HP for five turns.
heal-block.name: Heal Block

heal-order.description:
The user calls out its underlings to
heal it. The user regains up to half of its
max HP.
heal-order.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.
heal-order.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
heal-order.name: Heal Order

heal-pulse.description:
The user emits a healing pulse which
restores the target’s HP by up to
half of its max HP.
heal-pulse.effect_long: Heals the target for half its max HP.
heal-pulse.effect_short: Heals the target for half its max HP.
heal-pulse.name: Heal Pulse

healing-wish.description:
The user faints. In return, the Pokémon
taking its place will have its HP restored
and status conditions cured.
healing-wish.effect_long: User faints.  Its replacement's HP is fully restored, and any major status effect is removed.  If the replacement Pokémon is immediately fainted by a switch-in effect, the next replacement is healed by this move instead.
healing-wish.effect_short: User faints.  Its replacement has its HP fully restored and any major status effect removed.
healing-wish.name: Healing Wish

heart-stamp.description:
The user unleashes a vicious blow after
its cute act makes the target less wary.
This may also make the target flinch.
heart-stamp.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
heart-stamp.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
heart-stamp.name: Heart Stamp

heart-swap.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
switch stat changes with the target.
heart-swap.effect_long: User swaps its stat modifiers with the target.
heart-swap.effect_short: User and target swap stat changes.
heart-swap.name: Heart Swap

heat-crash.description:
The user slams its target with its flame-
covered body. The more the user outweighs
the target, the greater the move’s power.
heat-crash.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  The greater the user's weight compared to the target's, the higher power this move has, to a maximum of 120.

User's weight                    | Power
-------------------------------- | ----:
Up to 2× the target's weight     |    40
Up to 3× the target's weight     |    60
Up to 4× the target's weight     |    80
Up to 5× the target's weight     |   100
More than 5× the target's weight |   120
heat-crash.effect_short: Power is higher when the user weighs more than the target, up to a maximum of 120.
heat-crash.name: Heat Crash

heat-wave.description:
The user attacks by exhaling hot breath
on the opposing Pokémon. This may also leave
those Pokémon with a burn.
heat-wave.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
heat-wave.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
heat-wave.name: Heat Wave

heavy-slam.description:
The user slams into the target with its
heavy body. The more the user outweighs
the target, the greater the move’s power.
heavy-slam.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  The greater the user's weight compared to the target's, the higher power this move has, to a maximum of 120.

User's weight                    | Power
-------------------------------- | ----:
Up to 2× the target's weight     |    40
Up to 3× the target's weight     |    60
Up to 4× the target's weight     |    80
Up to 5× the target's weight     |   100
More than 5× the target's weight |   120
heavy-slam.effect_short: Power is higher when the user weighs more than the target, up to a maximum of 120.
heavy-slam.name: Heavy Slam

helping-hand.description:
The user assists an ally by boosting
the power of that ally’s attack.
helping-hand.effect_long:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
helping-hand.effect_short: Ally's next move inflicts half more damage.
helping-hand.name: Helping Hand

hex.description:
This relentless attack does massive
damage to a target affected
by status conditions.
hex.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has a major status ailment, this move has double power.
hex.effect_short: Has double power if the target has a major status ailment.
hex.name: Hex

hidden-power.description:
A unique attack that varies in type
depending on the Pokémon using it.
hidden-power.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.
hidden-power.effect_short: Power and type depend upon user's IVs.  Power can range from 30 to 70.
hidden-power.name: Hidden Power

high-jump-kick.description:
The target is attacked with a knee kick
from a jump. If it misses, the user is
hurt instead.
high-jump-kick.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If this move misses, is blocked by protect or detect, or has no effect, the user takes half the damage it would have inflicted in recoil.  This recoil damage will not exceed half the user's max HP.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.
high-jump-kick.effect_short: If the user misses, it takes half the damage it would have inflicted in recoil.
high-jump-kick.name: High Jump Kick

hold-back.description:
The user holds back when it attacks
and the target is left with at least 1 HP.
hold-back.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Will not reduce the target's HP below 1.
hold-back.effect_short: Cannot lower the target's HP below 1.
hold-back.name: Hold Back

hold-hands.description:
The user and an ally hold hands.
This makes them very happy.
hold-hands.effect_long: This move has a unique effect, but it is unreleased, so the specific effect is unknown.
hold-hands.name: Hold Hands

hone-claws.description:
The user sharpens its claws to
boost its Attack stat and accuracy.
hone-claws.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by one stage.
hone-claws.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by one stage.
hone-claws.name: Hone Claws

horn-attack.description:
The target is jabbed with a sharply
pointed horn to inflict damage.
horn-attack.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
horn-attack.name: Horn Attack

horn-drill.description:
The user stabs the target with a horn
that rotates like a drill. The target
faints instantly if this attack hits.
horn-drill.effect_long:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
horn-drill.name: Horn Drill

horn-leech.description:
The user drains the target’s energy with
its horns. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
horn-leech.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
horn-leech.effect_short: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
horn-leech.name: Horn Leech

howl.description:
The user howls loudly to raise its spirit,
which raises its Attack stat.
howl.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
howl.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
howl.name: Howl

hurricane.description:
The user attacks by wrapping its opponent
in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky.
This may also confuse the target.
hurricane.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.
hurricane.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
hurricane.name: Hurricane

hydro-cannon.description:
The target is hit with a watery blast.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
hydro-cannon.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
hydro-cannon.effect_short: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
hydro-cannon.name: Hydro Cannon

hydro-pump.description:
The target is blasted by a huge volume
of water launched under great pressure.
hydro-pump.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
hydro-pump.name: Hydro Pump

hyper-beam.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful
beam. The user can’t move on the next turn.
hyper-beam.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
hyper-beam.effect_short: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
hyper-beam.name: Hyper Beam

hyper-fang.description:
The user bites hard on the target
with its sharp front fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
hyper-fang.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
hyper-fang.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
hyper-fang.name: Hyper Fang

hyper-voice.description:
The user lets loose a horribly echoing
shout with the power to inflict damage.
hyper-voice.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
hyper-voice.name: Hyper Voice

hyperspace-hole.description:
Using a hyperspace hole, the user appears
right next to the target and strikes. This
also hits a target using Protect or Detect.
hyperspace-hole.effect_long: This move has a unique effect, but it is unreleased, so the specific effect is unknown.
hyperspace-hole.name: Hyperspace Hole

hypnosis.description:
The user employs hypnotic suggestion
to make the target fall into a deep sleep.
hypnosis.name: Hypnosis

ice-ball.description:
The user continually rolls into the target
over five turns. It becomes stronger
each time it hits.
ice-ball.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
ice-ball.effect_short: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.
ice-ball.name: Ice Ball

ice-beam.description:
The target is struck with an icy-cold
beam of energy.
This may also leave the target frozen.
ice-beam.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
ice-beam.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
ice-beam.name: Ice Beam

ice-burn.description:
On the second turn, an ultracold,
freezing wind surrounds the target.
This may leave the target with a burn.
ice-burn.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.  User charges for one turn before attacking.
ice-burn.effect_short: Requires a turn to charge before attacking.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
ice-burn.name: Ice Burn

ice-fang.description:
The user bites with cold-infused fangs.
This may also make the target flinch or
leave it frozen.
ice-fang.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target and a separate $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
ice-fang.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target and a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
ice-fang.name: Ice Fang

ice-punch.description:
The target is punched with an icy fist.
This may also leave the target frozen.
ice-punch.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
ice-punch.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
ice-punch.name: Ice Punch

ice-shard.description:
The user flash-freezes chunks of
ice and hurls them at the target.
This move always goes first.
ice-shard.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
ice-shard.name: Ice Shard

icicle-crash.description:
The user attacks by harshly dropping
large icicles onto the target.
This may also make the target flinch.
icicle-crash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
icicle-crash.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
icicle-crash.name: Icicle Crash

icicle-spear.description:
The user launches sharp icicles at the
target two to five times in a row.
icicle-spear.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
icicle-spear.name: Icicle Spear

icy-wind.description:
The user attacks with a gust of chilled air.
This also lowers the opposing Pokémon’s
Speed stats.
icy-wind.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
icy-wind.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
icy-wind.name: Icy Wind

imprison.description:
If opposing Pokémon know any move
also known by the user,
they are prevented from using it.
imprison.effect_long: Prevents any Pokémon on the opposing side of the field from using any move the user knows until the user leaves the field.  This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted.  If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user's moves when this move is used, this move will fail.
imprison.effect_short: Prevents the target from using any moves that the user also knows.
imprison.name: Imprison

incinerate.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
incinerate.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.
incinerate.name: Incinerate

inferno.description:
The user attacks by engulfing the target
in an intense fire. This leaves the target
with a burn.
inferno.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
inferno.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
inferno.name: Inferno

infestation.description:
The target is infested and attacked for
four to five turns.
The target can’t flee during this time.
infestation.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.
infestation.effect_short: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
infestation.name: Infestation

ingrain.description:
The user lays roots that restore
its HP on every turn. Because it is
rooted, it can’t switch out.
ingrain.effect_long:
Prevents the user from switching out.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP at the end of every turn.  If the user was immune to ground attacks, it will now take normal damage from them.

roar and whirlwind will not affect the user.  The user cannot use magnet-rise.

The user may still use u-turn to leave the field.

This effect can be passed with baton-pass.
ingrain.effect_short: Prevents the user from leaving battle.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP every turn.
ingrain.name: Ingrain

ion-deluge.description:
The user disperses electrically charged
particles, which changes Normal-type
moves to Electric-type moves.
ion-deluge.effect_long: Changes all Pokémon's normal moves to electric moves for the rest of the turn.
ion-deluge.effect_short: Changes all normal moves to electric moves for the rest of the turn.
ion-deluge.name: Ion Deluge

iron-defense.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface
like iron, sharply raising its
Defense stat.
iron-defense.effect_long: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
iron-defense.effect_short: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.
iron-defense.name: Iron Defense

iron-head.description:
The user slams the target
with its steel-hard head.
This may also make the target flinch.
iron-head.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
iron-head.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
iron-head.name: Iron Head

iron-tail.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard
tail. This may also lower the target’s
Defense stat.
iron-tail.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
iron-tail.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
iron-tail.name: Iron Tail

judgment.description:
The user releases countless shots of
light at the target. This move’s type varies
depending on the kind of Plate the user is holding.
judgment.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is holding a plate or a drive, this move's type is the type corresponding to that item.

Note: This effect is technically shared by both techno-blast and judgment; however, Techno Blast is only affected by drives, and Judgment is only affected by plates.
judgment.effect_short: If the user is holding a appropriate plate or drive, the damage inflicted will match it.
judgment.name: Judgment

jump-kick.description:
The user jumps up high, then strikes
with a kick. If the kick misses, the
user hurts itself.
jump-kick.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If this move misses, is blocked by protect or detect, or has no effect, the user takes half the damage it would have inflicted in recoil.  This recoil damage will not exceed half the user's max HP.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.
jump-kick.effect_short: If the user misses, it takes half the damage it would have inflicted in recoil.
jump-kick.name: Jump Kick

karate-chop.description:
The target is attacked with a sharp chop.
Critical hits land more easily.
karate-chop.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
karate-chop.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
karate-chop.name: Karate Chop

kinesis.description:
The user distracts the target
by bending a spoon.
This lowers the target’s accuracy.
kinesis.effect_long: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
kinesis.effect_short: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
kinesis.name: Kinesis

kings-shield.description:
The user takes a defensive stance while it protects
itself from damage. It also harshly lowers the Attack
stat of any attacker who makes direct contact.
kings-shield.effect_long: Blocks damaging attacks and lowers attacking Pokémon's Attack by two stages on contact.  Switches Aegislash to Shield Forme.
kings-shield.effect_short: Blocks damaging attacks and lowers attacking Pokémon's Attack by two stages on contact.  Switches Aegislash to Shield Forme.
kings-shield.name: King's Shield

knock-off.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and
that item can’t be used in that battle. The move
does more damage if the target has a held item.
knock-off.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky-hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.
knock-off.name: Knock Off

lands-wrath.description:
The user gathers the energy of the land
and focuses that power on opposing
Pokémon to damage them.
lands-wrath.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
lands-wrath.name: Land's Wrath

last-resort.description:
This move can be used only after the user
has used all the other moves it knows
in the battle.
last-resort.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  This move can only be used if each of the user's other moves has been used at least once since the user entered the field.  If this is the user's only move, this move will fail.
last-resort.effect_short: Can only be used after all of the user's other moves have been used.
last-resort.name: Last Resort

lava-plume.description:
The user torches everything around it
with an inferno of scarlet flames.
This may also leave those hit with a burn.
lava-plume.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
lava-plume.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
lava-plume.name: Lava Plume

leaf-blade.description:
The user handles a sharp leaf like a
sword and attacks by cutting its target.
Critical hits land more easily.
leaf-blade.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
leaf-blade.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
leaf-blade.name: Leaf Blade

leaf-storm.description:
The user whips up a storm of leaves around
the target. The attack’s recoil harshly
lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
leaf-storm.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
leaf-storm.effect_short: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
leaf-storm.name: Leaf Storm

leaf-tornado.description:
The user attacks its target by
encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack
may also lower the target’s accuracy.
leaf-tornado.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
leaf-tornado.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
leaf-tornado.name: Leaf Tornado

leech-life.description:
The user drains the target’s blood.
The user’s HP is restored by half the
damage taken by the target.
leech-life.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
leech-life.effect_short: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
leech-life.name: Leech Life

leech-seed.description:
A seed is planted on the target. It steals
some HP from the target every turn.
leech-seed.effect_long:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid-ooze.

rapid-spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
leech-seed.effect_short: Seeds the target, stealing HP from it every turn.
leech-seed.name: Leech Seed

leer.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon
an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.
leer.effect_long: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
leer.effect_short: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
leer.name: Leer

lick.description:
The target is licked with a long tongue,
causing damage. This may also leave
the target with paralysis.
lick.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
lick.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
lick.name: Lick

light-of-ruin.description:
Drawing power from the Eternal Flower,
the user fires a powerful beam of light.
This also damages the user quite a lot.
light-of-ruin.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
light-of-ruin.effect_short: User receives 1/2 the damage inflicted in recoil.
light-of-ruin.name: Light of Ruin

light-screen.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to
reduce damage from special attacks
for five turns.
light-screen.effect_long:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.
light-screen.effect_short: Reduces damage from special attacks by 50% for five turns.
light-screen.name: Light Screen

lock-on.description:
The user takes sure aim at the target.
This ensures the next attack does not
miss the target.
lock-on.effect_long:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
lock-on.effect_short: Ensures that the user's next move will hit the target.
lock-on.name: Lock-On

lovely-kiss.description:
With a scary face, the user tries to
force a kiss on the target. If it
succeeds, the target falls asleep.
lovely-kiss.name: Lovely Kiss

low-kick.description:
A powerful low kick that makes the target
fall over. The heavier the target,
the greater the move’s power.
low-kick.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120
low-kick.effect_short: Inflicts more damage to heavier targets, with a maximum of 120 power.
low-kick.name: Low Kick

low-sweep.description:
The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs,
which lowers the target’s Speed stat.
low-sweep.effect_long: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
low-sweep.effect_short: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
low-sweep.name: Low Sweep

lucky-chant.description:
The user chants an incantation toward
the sky, preventing opposing Pokémon
from landing critical hits.
lucky-chant.effect_long: For five turns, opposing Pokémon cannot score critical hits.
lucky-chant.effect_short: Prevents the target from scoring critical hits for five turns.
lucky-chant.name: Lucky Chant

lunar-dance.description:
The user faints. In return, the Pokémon
taking its place will have its status and
HP fully restored.
lunar-dance.effect_long: User faints.  Its replacement's HP and PP are fully restored, and any major status effect is removed.
lunar-dance.effect_short: User faints, and its replacement is fully healed.
lunar-dance.name: Lunar Dance

luster-purge.description:
The user lets loose a damaging burst
of light. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
luster-purge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
luster-purge.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
luster-purge.name: Luster Purge

mach-punch.description:
The user throws a punch at blinding
speed. This move always goes first.
mach-punch.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
mach-punch.name: Mach Punch

magic-coat.description:
A barrier reflects back to the target
moves like Leech Seed and moves
that damage status.
magic-coat.effect_long:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effects, stat changes, or trapping effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter-dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro-acid, leech-seed, swagger, worry-seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
magic-coat.effect_short: Reflects back the first effect move used on the user this turn.
magic-coat.name: Magic Coat

magic-room.description:
The user creates a bizarre area
in which Pokémon’s held items
lose their effects for five turns.
magic-room.effect_long: For five turns (including this one), passive effects of held items are ignored, and Pokémon will not use their held items.
magic-room.effect_short: Negates held items for five turns.
magic-room.name: Magic Room

magical-leaf.description:
The user scatters curious leaves
that chase the target.
This attack never misses.
magical-leaf.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
magical-leaf.name: Magical Leaf

magma-storm.description:
The target becomes trapped
within a maelstrom of fire that rages
for four to five turns.
magma-storm.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.
magma-storm.effect_short: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
magma-storm.name: Magma Storm

magnet-bomb.description:
The user launches steel bombs that
stick to the target.
This attack never misses.
magnet-bomb.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
magnet-bomb.name: Magnet Bomb

magnet-rise.description:
The user levitates using electrically
generated magnetism for five turns.
magnet-rise.effect_long:
For five turns, the user is immune to ground moves.

If the user is under the effect of ingrain or has levitate, this move will fail.

This effect is temporarily disabled by and cannot be used during gravity.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
magnet-rise.effect_short: User is immune to Ground moves and effects for five turns.
magnet-rise.name: Magnet Rise

magnetic-flux.description:
The user manipulates magnetic fields,
which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats
of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
magnetic-flux.effect_long: Raises the Defense and Special Defense of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage.
magnetic-flux.effect_short: Raises the Defense and Special Defense of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage.
magnetic-flux.name: Magnetic Flux

magnitude.description:
The user attacks everything around it
with a ground-shaking quake.
Its power varies.
magnitude.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.
magnitude.name: Magnitude

mat-block.description:
Using a pulled-up mat as a shield, the user
protects itself and its allies from damaging moves.
This does not stop status moves.
mat-block.effect_long: Protects all friendly Pokémon from damaging moves.  Only works on the first turn after the user is sent out.
mat-block.effect_short: Protects all friendly Pokémon from damaging moves.  Only works on the first turn after the user is sent out.
mat-block.name: Mat Block

me-first.description:
The user cuts ahead of the target to steal and
use the target’s intended move with greater power.
This move fails if it isn’t used first.
me-first.effect_long:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.
me-first.effect_short: Uses the target's move against it before it attacks, with power increased by half.
me-first.name: Me First

mean-look.description:
The user pins the target with a dark,
arresting look.
The target becomes unable to flee.
mean-look.effect_long:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton-pass, u-turn, or a shed-shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton-pass.
mean-look.effect_short: Prevents the target from leaving battle.
mean-look.name: Mean Look

meditate.description:
The user meditates to awaken the power
deep within its body and raise its
Attack stat.
meditate.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
meditate.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
meditate.name: Meditate

mega-drain.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s
HP is restored by half the damage taken
by the target.
mega-drain.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
mega-drain.effect_short: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
mega-drain.name: Mega Drain

mega-kick.description:
The target is attacked by a kick launched
with muscle-packed power.
mega-kick.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
mega-kick.name: Mega Kick

mega-punch.description:
The target is slugged by a punch thrown
with muscle-packed power.
mega-punch.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
mega-punch.name: Mega Punch

megahorn.description:
Using its tough and impressive horn,
the user rams into the target
with no letup.
megahorn.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
megahorn.name: Megahorn

memento.description:
The user faints when using this move.
In return, this harshly lowers the target’s
Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
memento.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
memento.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
memento.name: Memento

metal-burst.description:
The user retaliates with much greater
power against the target
that last inflicted damage on it.
metal-burst.effect_long: Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a damaging move this turn.  Inflicts 1.5× the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.
metal-burst.effect_short: Strikes back at the last Pokémon to hit the user this turn with 1.5× the damage.
metal-burst.name: Metal Burst

metal-claw.description:
The target is raked with steel claws.
This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.
metal-claw.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack one stage.
metal-claw.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack by one stage.
metal-claw.name: Metal Claw

metal-sound.description:
A horrible sound like scraping metal
harshly lowers the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
metal-sound.effect_long: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
metal-sound.effect_short: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
metal-sound.name: Metal Sound

meteor-mash.description:
The target is hit with a hard punch fired
like a meteor. This may also raise
the user’s Attack stat.
meteor-mash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack one stage.
meteor-mash.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack by one stage.
meteor-mash.name: Meteor Mash

metronome.description:
The user waggles a finger and stimulates
its brain into randomly using nearly
any move.
metronome.editor_note: In PBR, the user is locked into the selected move until it fully executes either by hitting, missing, or failing. In other words, if the game says it can't be used or there is no target, it will keep trying to use the move.
metronome.effect_long:
Selects any move at random and uses it.  Moves the user already knows are not eligible.  Assist, meta, protection, and reflection moves are also not eligible; specifically, assist, chatter, copycat, counter, covet, destiny-bond, detect, endure, feint, focus-punch, follow-me, helping-hand, me-first, metronome, mimic, mirror-coat, mirror-move, protect, quick-guard, sketch, sleep-talk, snatch, struggle, switcheroo, thief, trick, and wide-guard will not be selected by this move.

This move cannot be copied by mimic or mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.
metronome.effect_short: Randomly selects and uses any move in the game.
metronome.name: Metronome

milk-drink.description:
The user restores its own HP
by up to half of its max HP.
May also be used in the field to heal HP.
milk-drink.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.
milk-drink.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
milk-drink.name: Milk Drink

mimic.description:
The user copies the target’s last move.
The move can be used during battle
until the Pokémon is switched out.
mimic.effect_long:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.
mimic.effect_short: Copies the target's last used move.
mimic.name: Mimic

mind-reader.description:
The user senses the target’s movements
with its mind to ensure its next
attack does not miss the target.
mind-reader.effect_long:
If the user targets the same target again before the end of the next turn, the move it uses is guaranteed to hit.  This move itself also ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

One-hit KO moves are also guaranteed to hit, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  This effect also allows the user to hit Pokémon that are off the field due to moves such as dig or fly.

If the target uses detect or protect while under the effect of this move, the user is not guaranteed to hit, but has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
mind-reader.effect_short: Ensures that the user's next move will hit the target.
mind-reader.name: Mind Reader

minimize.description:
The user compresses its body
to make itself look smaller,
which sharply raises its evasiveness.
minimize.effect_long:
Raises the user's evasion by two stages.

stomp and steamroller have double power against Pokémon that have used this move since entering the field.
minimize.effect_short: Raises the user's evasion by two stages.
minimize.name: Minimize

miracle-eye.description:
Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by
Psychic-type attacks. This also enables
an evasive target to be hit.
miracle-eye.effect_long: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A dark Pokémon under this effect takes normal damage from psychic moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
miracle-eye.effect_short: Forces the target to have no evasion, and allows it to be hit by Psychic moves even if it's Dark.
miracle-eye.name: Miracle Eye

mirror-coat.description:
A retaliation move that counters any
special attack, inflicting double the
damage taken.
mirror-coat.effect_long:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
mirror-coat.effect_short: Inflicts twice the damage the user received from the last special hit it took.
mirror-coat.name: Mirror Coat

mirror-move.description:
The user counters the target by mimicking
the target’s last move.
mirror-move.effect_long:
Uses the last move targeted at the user by a Pokémon still on the field.  A move counts as targeting the user even if it hit multiple Pokémon, as long as the user was one of them; however, moves targeting the field itself do not count.  If the user has not been targeted by an appropriate move since entering the field, or if no Pokémon that targeted the user remains on the field, this move will fail.

Moves that failed, missed, had no effect, or were blocked are still copied.

Assist moves, time-delayed moves, “meta” moves that operate on other moves/Pokémon/abilities, and some other special moves cannot be copied and are ignored; if the last move to hit the user was such a move, the previous move will be used instead.  The full list of ignored moves is: acid-armor, acupressure, after-you, agility, ally-switch, amnesia, aqua-ring, aromatherapy, aromatic-mist, assist, autotomize, barrier, baton-pass, belch, belly-drum, bide, bulk-up, calm-mind, camouflage, celebrate, charge, coil, conversion, conversion-2, copycat, cosmic-power, cotton-guard, counter, crafty-shield, curse, defend-order, defense-curl, destiny-bond, detect, doom-desire, double-team, dragon-dance, electric-terrain, endure, final-gambit, flower-shield, focus-energy, focus-punch, follow-me, future-sight, geomancy, grassy-terrain, gravity, growth, grudge, guard-split, hail, happy-hour, harden, haze, heal-bell, heal-order, heal-pulse, healing-wish, helping-hand, hold-hands, hone-claws, howl, imprison, ingrain, ion-deluge, iron-defense, kings-shield, light-screen, lucky-chant, lunar-dance, magic-coat, magnet-rise, magnetic-flux, mat-block, me-first, meditate, metronome, milk-drink, mimic, minimize, mirror-coat, mirror-move, mist, misty-terrain, moonlight, morning-sun, mud-sport, nasty-plot, nature-power, perish-song, power-split, power-trick, protect, psych-up, quick-guard, quiver-dance, rage-powder, rain-dance, recover, recycle, reflect, reflect-type, refresh, rest, rock-polish, role-play, roost, rototiller, safeguard, sandstorm, shadow-blast, shadow-bolt, shadow-half, shadow-rush, shadow-shed, shadow-sky, shadow-storm, shadow-wave, sharpen, shell-smash, shift-gear, sketch, slack-off, sleep-talk, snatch, soft-boiled, spikes, spiky-shield, spit-up, splash, stealth-rock, sticky-web, stockpile, struggle, substitute, sunny-day, swallow, swords-dance, synthesis, tail-glow, tailwind, teleport, toxic-spikes, transform, water-sport, wide-guard, wish, withdraw and work-up.

This move cannot be selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk, nor forced by encore.
mirror-move.effect_short: Uses the target's last used move.
mirror-move.name: Mirror Move

mirror-shot.description:
The user lets loose a flash of energy at
the target from its polished body.
This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
mirror-shot.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mirror-shot.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mirror-shot.name: Mirror Shot

mist.description:
The user cloaks itself and its allies in a
white mist that prevents any of their stats
from being lowered for five turns.
mist.effect_long:
Pokémon on the user's side of the field are immune to stat-lowering effects for five turns.

guard-swap, heart-swap, and power-swap may still be used.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.
mist.effect_short: Protects the user's stats from being changed by enemy moves.
mist.name: Mist

mist-ball.description:
A mist-like flurry of down envelops and
damages the target. This may also lower
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
mist-ball.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
mist-ball.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
mist-ball.name: Mist Ball

misty-terrain.description:
The user covers the ground under everyone’s feet
with mist for five turns. This protects Pokémon
on the ground from status conditions.
misty-terrain.effect_long:
For five turns, protects all Pokémon on the ground from major status ailments and confusion and weakens dragon moves used against them to 0.5× their power.

Changes nature-power to moonblast.
misty-terrain.effect_short: For five turns, protects all Pokémon on the ground from major status ailments and confusion, and halves the power of incoming dragon moves.
misty-terrain.name: Misty Terrain

moonblast.description:
Borrowing the power of the moon,
the user attacks the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
moonblast.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
moonblast.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
moonblast.name: Moonblast

moonlight.description:
The user restores its own HP.
The amount of HP regained varies
with the weather.
moonlight.effect_long:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
moonlight.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
moonlight.name: Moonlight

morning-sun.description:
The user restores its own HP.
The amount of HP regained varies
with the weather.
morning-sun.effect_long:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
morning-sun.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
morning-sun.name: Morning Sun

mud-bomb.description:
The user launches a hard-packed
mud ball to attack.
This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
mud-bomb.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mud-bomb.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mud-bomb.name: Mud Bomb

mud-shot.description:
The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud
at the target.
This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
mud-shot.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
mud-shot.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
mud-shot.name: Mud Shot

mud-slap.description:
The user hurls mud in the target’s face to
inflict damage and lower its accuracy.
mud-slap.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mud-slap.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
mud-slap.name: Mud-Slap

mud-sport.description:
The user covers itself with mud.
This weakens Electric-type moves
for five turns.
mud-sport.effect_long: electric moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
mud-sport.name: Mud Sport

muddy-water.description:
The user attacks by shooting muddy water
at the opposing Pokémon.
This may also lower their accuracy.
muddy-water.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
muddy-water.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
muddy-water.name: Muddy Water

mystical-fire.description:
The user attacks by breathing
a special, hot fire. This also
lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
mystical-fire.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
mystical-fire.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
mystical-fire.name: Mystical Fire

nasty-plot.description:
The user stimulates its brain by thinking
bad thoughts.
This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk.
nasty-plot.effect_long: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
nasty-plot.effect_short: Raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
nasty-plot.name: Nasty Plot

natural-gift.description:
The user draws power to attack by using
its held Berry.
The Berry determines the move’s type and power.
natural-gift.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.
natural-gift.effect_short: Power and type depend on the held berry.
natural-gift.name: Natural Gift

nature-power.description:
An attack that makes use of nature’s
power. Its effects vary depending on the
user’s environment.
nature-power.effect_long:
Uses another move chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain                   | Selected move
------------------------- | ------------------
Building                  | tri-attack
Cave                      | rock-slide
Deep water                | hydro-pump
Desert                    | earthquake
Grass                     | seed-bomb
Mountain                  | rock-slide
Road                      | earthquake
Shallow water             | hydro-pump
Snow                      | blizzard
Tall grass                | seed-bomb
electric-terrain | thunderbolt
grassy-terrain   | energy-ball
misty-terrain    | moonblast

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Selected move
-------------- | ------------------
Courtyard      | tri-attack
Crystal        | rock-slide
Gateway        | hydro-pump
Magma          | rock-slide
Main Street    | tri-attack
Neon           | tri-attack
Stargazer      | rock-slide
Sunny Park     | seed-bomb
Sunset         | earthquake
Waterfall      | seed-bomb

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
nature-power.effect_short: Uses a move which depends upon the terrain.
nature-power.name: Nature Power

needle-arm.description:
The user attacks by wildly swinging its
thorny arms. This may also make the
target flinch.
needle-arm.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
needle-arm.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
needle-arm.name: Needle Arm

night-daze.description:
The user lets loose a pitch-black shock
wave at its target. This may also lower the
target’s accuracy.
night-daze.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
night-daze.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
night-daze.name: Night Daze

night-shade.description:
The user makes the target see a
frightening mirage. It inflicts damage
equal to the user’s level.
night-shade.effect_long: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.
night-shade.effect_short: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.
night-shade.name: Night Shade

night-slash.description:
The user slashes the target
the instant an opportunity arises.
Critical hits land more easily.
night-slash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
night-slash.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
night-slash.name: Night Slash

nightmare.description:
A sleeping target sees a nightmare
that inflicts some damage every turn.
nightmare.effect_long: Only works on sleeping Pokémon.  Gives the target a nightmare, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.  If the target wakes up or leaves the field, this effect ends.
nightmare.effect_short: Target loses 1/4 its max HP every turn as long as it's asleep.
nightmare.name: Nightmare

noble-roar.description:
Letting out a noble roar, the user
intimidates the target and lowers
its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
noble-roar.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage.
noble-roar.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage.
noble-roar.name: Noble Roar

nuzzle.description:
The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified
cheeks against the target. This also leaves
the target with paralysis.
nuzzle.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
nuzzle.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
nuzzle.name: Nuzzle

oblivion-wing.description:
The user absorbs its target’s HP.
The user’s HP is restored by over half
of the damage taken by the target.
oblivion-wing.effect_long: Deals regular damage.  Drains 75% of the damage inflicted to heal the user.
oblivion-wing.effect_short: Drains 75% of the damage inflicted to heal the user.
oblivion-wing.name: Oblivion Wing

octazooka.description:
The user attacks by spraying ink in the
target’s face or eyes.
This may also lower the target’s accuracy.
octazooka.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
octazooka.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.
octazooka.name: Octazooka

odor-sleuth.description:
Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by
Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also
enables an evasive target to be hit.
odor-sleuth.effect_long: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
odor-sleuth.effect_short: Forces the target to have no Evade, and allows it to be hit by Normal and Fighting moves even if it's a Ghost.
odor-sleuth.name: Odor Sleuth

ominous-wind.description:
The user blasts the target with a gust of
repulsive wind. This may also raise all the
user’s stats at once.
ominous-wind.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.
ominous-wind.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise all of the user's stats by one stage.
ominous-wind.name: Ominous Wind

outrage.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two
to three turns.
The user then becomes confused.
outrage.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.
outrage.effect_short: Hits every turn for 2-3 turns, then confuses the user.
outrage.name: Outrage

overheat.description:
The user attacks the target at full power.
The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the
user’s Sp. Atk stat.
overheat.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
overheat.effect_short: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
overheat.name: Overheat

pain-split.description:
The user adds its HP to the target’s HP,
then equally shares the combined HP
with the target.
pain-split.effect_long:
Changes the user's and target's remaining HP to the average of their current remaining HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect does not count as inflicting damage for other moves and effects that respond to damage taken.

This effect fails against a substitute.
pain-split.effect_short: Sets the user's and targets's HP to the average of their current HP.
pain-split.name: Pain Split

parabolic-charge.description:
The user attacks everything around it.
The user’s HP is restored by half
the damage taken by those hit.
parabolic-charge.effect_long: Heals the user for half the total damage dealt to all targets.
parabolic-charge.effect_short: Heals the user for half the total damage dealt to all targets.
parabolic-charge.name: Parabolic Charge

parting-shot.description:
With a parting threat, the user lowers
the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
Then it switches with a party Pokémon.
parting-shot.effect_long: Lowers all targets' Attack and Special Attack by one stage.  Makes the user switch out.
parting-shot.effect_short: Lowers all targets' Attack and Special Attack by one stage.  Makes the user switch out.
parting-shot.name: Parting Shot

pay-day.description:
Numerous coins are hurled at the
target to inflict damage.
Money is earned after the battle.
pay-day.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  After the battle ends, the winner receives five times the user's level in extra money for each time this move was used.
pay-day.effect_short: Scatters money on the ground worth five times the user's level.
pay-day.name: Pay Day

payback.description:
The user stores power, then attacks.
If the user moves after the target,
this attack’s power will be doubled.
payback.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.
payback.effect_short: Power is doubled if the target has already moved this turn.
payback.name: Payback

peck.description:
The target is jabbed with a sharply
pointed beak or horn.
peck.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
peck.name: Peck

perish-song.description:
Any Pokémon that hears this song
faints in three turns, unless it switches
out of battle.
perish-song.effect_long:
Every Pokémon is given a counter that starts at 3 and decreases by 1 at the end of every turn, including this one.  When a Pokémon's counter reaches zero, that Pokémon faints.  A Pokémon that leaves the field will lose its counter; its replacement does not inherit the effect, and other Pokémon's counters remain.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
perish-song.effect_short: User and target both faint after three turns.
perish-song.name: Perish Song

petal-blizzard.description:
The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard
and attacks everything around it.
petal-blizzard.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
petal-blizzard.name: Petal Blizzard

petal-dance.description:
The user attacks the target by scattering
petals for two to three turns.
The user then becomes confused.
petal-dance.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.
petal-dance.effect_short: Hits every turn for 2-3 turns, then confuses the user.
petal-dance.name: Petal Dance

phantom-force.description:
The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes
the target on the next turn.
This move hits even if the target protects itself.
phantom-force.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User vanishes for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

This move ignores the effects of detect and protect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
phantom-force.effect_short: User vanishes, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.  Hits through Protect and Detect.
phantom-force.name: Phantom Force

pin-missile.description:
Sharp spikes are shot at the target
in rapid succession.
They hit two to five times in a row.
pin-missile.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
pin-missile.name: Pin Missile

play-nice.description:
The user and the target become friends,
and the target loses its will to fight.
This lowers the target’s Attack stat.
play-nice.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
play-nice.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
play-nice.name: Play Nice

play-rough.description:
The user plays rough with the target
and attacks it. This may also lower
the target’s Attack stat.
play-rough.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Attack by one stage.
play-rough.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Attack by one stage.
play-rough.name: Play Rough

pluck.description:
The user pecks the target. If the target
is holding a Berry, the user eats it and
gains its effect.
pluck.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.
pluck.effect_short: If target has a berry, inflicts double damage and uses the berry.
pluck.name: Pluck

poison-fang.description:
The user bites the target with toxic
fangs. This may also leave the target
badly poisoned.
poison-fang.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to badly poison the target.
poison-fang.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to badly poison the target.
poison-fang.name: Poison Fang

poison-gas.description:
A cloud of poison gas is sprayed
in the face of opposing Pokémon.
This may also poison those hit.
poison-gas.name: Poison Gas

poison-jab.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle or
arm steeped in poison. This may also
poison the target.
poison-jab.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-jab.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-jab.name: Poison Jab

poison-powder.description:
The user scatters a cloud of poisonous
dust on the target. This may also poison
the target.
poison-powder.name: Poison Powder

poison-sting.description:
The user stabs the target
with a poisonous stinger.
This may also poison the target.
poison-sting.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-sting.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-sting.name: Poison Sting

poison-tail.description:
The user hits the target with its tail.
This may also poison the target.
Critical hits land more easily.
poison-tail.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-tail.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit and a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
poison-tail.name: Poison Tail

pound.description:
The target is physically pounded with
a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.
pound.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
pound.name: Pound

powder.description:
The user covers the target in a powder
that explodes and damages the target
if it uses a Fire-type move.
powder.effect_long: Explodes if the target uses a fire move this turn, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP and preventing the move.
powder.effect_short: Explodes if the target uses a fire move this turn, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP and preventing the move.
powder.name: Powder

powder-snow.description:
The user attacks with a chilling gust
of powdery snow.
This may also freeze the opposing Pokémon.
powder-snow.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
powder-snow.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
