powder-snow.name: Powder Snow

power-gem.description:
The user attacks with a ray of light that
sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.
power-gem.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
power-gem.name: Power Gem

power-split.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats
with those of the target.
power-split.effect_long:
Averages the user's unmodified Attack with the target's unmodified Attack; the value becomes the unmodified Attack for both Pokémon. Unmodified Special Attack is averaged the same way.

This effect applies before any other persistent changes to unmodified Attack or Special Attack, such as flower-gift during sunny-day.
power-split.effect_short: Averages Attack and Special Attack with the target.
power-split.name: Power Split

power-swap.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
switch changes to its Attack and
Sp. Atk stats with the target.
power-swap.effect_long: User swaps its Attack and Special Attack stat modifiers modifiers with the target.
power-swap.effect_short: User swaps Attack and Special Attack changes with the target.
power-swap.name: Power Swap

power-trick.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
switch its Attack with its Defense stat.
power-trick.effect_long:
The user's original Attack and Defense are swapped.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
power-trick.name: Power Trick

power-up-punch.description:
Striking opponents over and over makes
the user’s fists harder.
Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
power-up-punch.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack one stage.
power-up-punch.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Attack by one stage.
power-up-punch.name: Power-Up Punch

power-whip.description:
The user violently whirls its vines or
tentacles to harshly lash the target.
power-whip.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
power-whip.name: Power Whip

present.description:
The user attacks by giving the target a
gift with a hidden trap. It restores
HP sometimes, however.
present.effect_long:
Randomly uses one of the following effects.

Effect                                             | Chance
-------------------------------------------------- | -----:
Inflicts regular damage with 40 power  |    40%
Inflicts regular damage with 80 power  |    30%
Inflicts regular damage with 120 power |    10%
Heals the target for 1/4 its max HP    |    20%

On average, this move inflicts regular damage with 52 power and heals the target for 1/20 its max HP.
present.effect_short: Randomly inflicts damage with power from 40 to 120 or heals the target for 1/4 its max HP.
present.name: Present

protect.description:
Enables the user to evade all attacks.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
protect.effect_long:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
protect.effect_short: Prevents any moves from hitting the user this turn.
protect.name: Protect

psybeam.description:
The target is attacked with a peculiar ray.
This may also leave the target confused.
psybeam.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
psybeam.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
psybeam.name: Psybeam

psych-up.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into
copying any stat change made
by the target.
psych-up.effect_long:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
psych-up.effect_short: Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.
psych-up.name: Psych Up

psychic.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic
force. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
psychic.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
psychic.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
psychic.name: Psychic

psycho-boost.description:
The user attacks the target at full power.
The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the
user’s Sp. Atk stat.
psycho-boost.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.
psycho-boost.effect_short: Lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
psycho-boost.name: Psycho Boost

psycho-cut.description:
The user tears at the target with blades
formed by psychic power.
Critical hits land more easily.
psycho-cut.editor_note: In PBR, there is an obscure but unconfirmed glitch (which may not necessarily related to this move) where the critical hit multiplier is passed onto the user's next move. If the user uses this move and it is intended to be a critical hit but misses, the user's next move (any damage move) will deal critical damage.
psycho-cut.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
psycho-cut.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
psycho-cut.name: Psycho Cut

psycho-shift.description:
Using its psychic power of suggestion,
the user transfers its status conditions
to the target.
psycho-shift.effect_long: If the user has a major status effect and the target does not, the user's status is transferred to the target.
psycho-shift.effect_short: Transfers the user's major status effect to the target.
psycho-shift.name: Psycho Shift

psyshock.description:
The user materializes an odd
psychic wave to attack the target.
This attack does physical damage.
psyshock.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.
psyshock.effect_short: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
psyshock.name: Psyshock

psystrike.description:
The user materializes an odd
psychic wave to attack the target.
This attack does physical damage.
psystrike.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.
psystrike.effect_short: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
psystrike.name: Psystrike

psywave.description:
The target is attacked with an odd
psychic wave.
The attack varies in intensity.
psywave.effect_long: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.
psywave.effect_short: Inflicts damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level.
psywave.name: Psywave

punishment.description:
The more the target has powered
up with stat changes, the greater
the move’s power.
punishment.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power starts at 60 and is increased by 20 for every stage any of the target's stats has been raised, capping at 200.  Accuracy and evasion modifiers do not increase this move's power.
punishment.effect_short: Power increases against targets with more raised stats, up to a maximum of 200.
punishment.name: Punishment

pursuit.description:
An attack move that inflicts double damage
if used on a target that is switching out
of battle.
pursuit.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow-me.
pursuit.effect_short: Has double power against, and can hit, Pokémon attempting to switch out.
pursuit.name: Pursuit

quash.description:
The user suppresses the target and
makes its move go last.
quash.effect_long: Forces the target to act last this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority.  If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.
quash.effect_short: Makes the target act last this turn.
quash.name: Quash

quick-attack.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed
that makes it almost invisible.
This move always goes first.
quick-attack.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
quick-attack.name: Quick Attack

quick-guard.description:
The user protects itself and its allies
from priority moves.
quick-guard.effect_long:
Moves with priority greater than 0 will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
quick-guard.effect_short: Prevents any priority moves from hitting friendly Pokémon this turn.
quick-guard.name: Quick Guard

quiver-dance.description:
The user lightly performs a beautiful,
mystic dance. This boosts the user’s
Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
quiver-dance.effect_long: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.
quiver-dance.effect_short: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.
quiver-dance.name: Quiver Dance

rage.description:
As long as this move is in use, the power
of rage raises the Attack stat each
time the user is hit in battle.
rage.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.
rage.effect_short: If the user is hit after using this move, its Attack rises by one stage.
rage.name: Rage

rage-powder.description:
The user scatters a cloud of irritating
powder to draw attention to itself.
Opponents aim only at the user.
rage-powder.effect_long:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning-rod and storm-drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
rage-powder.effect_short: Redirects the target's single-target effects to the user for this turn.
rage-powder.name: Rage Powder

rain-dance.description:
The user summons a heavy rain
that falls for five turns,
powering up Water-type moves.
rain-dance.effect_long:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.
rain-dance.effect_short: Changes the weather to rain for five turns.
rain-dance.name: Rain Dance

rapid-spin.description:
A spin attack that can also eliminate
such moves as Bind, Wrap, Leech Seed,
and Spikes.
rapid-spin.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes leech-seed from the user, frees the user from bind, clamp, fire-spin, magma-storm, sand-tomb, whirlpool, and wrap, and clears spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the user's side of the field.  If this move misses or has no effect, its effect doesn't activate.
rapid-spin.effect_short: Frees the user from binding moves, removes Leech Seed, and blows away Spikes.
rapid-spin.name: Rapid Spin

razor-leaf.description:
Sharp-edged leaves are launched
to slash at the opposing Pokémon.
Critical hits land more easily.
razor-leaf.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
razor-leaf.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
razor-leaf.name: Razor Leaf

razor-shell.description:
The user cuts its target with sharp
shells. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
razor-shell.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
razor-shell.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
razor-shell.name: Razor Shell

razor-wind.description:
A two-turn attack. Blades of wind hit
opposing Pokémon on the second turn.
Critical hits land more easily.
razor-wind.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
razor-wind.effect_short: Requires a turn to charge before attacking.
razor-wind.name: Razor Wind

recover.description:
Restoring its own cells, the user
restores its own HP by half of
its max HP.
recover.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.
recover.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
recover.name: Recover

recycle.description:
The user recycles a held item that
has been used in battle so it can be
used again.
recycle.effect_long:
User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field.  The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again.  If the user is holding an item, this move fails.

Items taken or given away by covet, knock-off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.
recycle.effect_short: User recovers the item it last used up.
recycle.name: Recycle

reflect.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to
reduce damage from physical attacks
for five turns.
reflect.effect_long:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.
reflect.effect_short: Reduces damage from physical attacks by half.
reflect.name: Reflect

reflect-type.description:
The user reflects the target’s type,
making it the same type as the target.
reflect-type.effect_long: User's type changes to match the target's.
reflect-type.name: Reflect Type

refresh.description:
The user rests to cure itself of a
poisoning, burn, or paralysis.
refresh.effect_long: Removes a burn, paralysis, or poison from the user.
refresh.effect_short: Cleanses the user of a burn, paralysis, or poison.
refresh.name: Refresh

relic-song.description:
The user sings an ancient song and attacks
by appealing to the hearts of the listening
opposing Pokémon. This may also induce sleep.
relic-song.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to put the target to sleep.
If the user is a meloetta, it will toggle between Aria and Pirouette Forme.
relic-song.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to put the target to sleep.
relic-song.name: Relic Song

rest.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns.
This fully restores the user’s HP and
heals any status conditions.
rest.effect_long:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.
rest.effect_short: User sleeps for two turns, completely healing itself.
rest.name: Rest

retaliate.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally.
If an ally fainted in the previous turn,
this move becomes more powerful.
retaliate.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon fainted on the previous turn, this move has double power.
retaliate.effect_short: Has double power if a friendly Pokémon fainted last turn.
retaliate.name: Retaliate

return.description:
A full-power attack that grows more
powerful the more the user likes
its Trainer.
return.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
return.effect_short: Power increases with happiness, up to a maximum of 102.
return.name: Return

revenge.description:
An attack move that inflicts double the
damage if the user has been hurt by the
opponent in the same turn.
revenge.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target damaged the user this turn and was the last to do so, this move has double power.

pain-split does not count as damaging the user.
revenge.effect_short: Inflicts double damage if the user takes damage before attacking this turn.
revenge.name: Revenge

reversal.description:
An all-out attack that becomes more
powerful the less HP the user has.
reversal.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20
reversal.effect_short: Inflicts more damage when the user has less HP remaining, with a maximum of 200 power.
reversal.name: Reversal

roar.description:
The target is scared off, and a different
Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild,
this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
roar.effect_long:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.
roar.effect_short: Immediately ends wild battles.  Forces trainers to switch Pokémon.
roar.name: Roar

roar-of-time.description:
The user blasts the target with power
that distorts even time.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
roar-of-time.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
roar-of-time.effect_short: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
roar-of-time.name: Roar of Time

rock-blast.description:
The user hurls hard rocks at the target.
Two to five rocks are launched in a row.
rock-blast.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
rock-blast.name: Rock Blast

rock-climb.description:
The user attacks the target by smashing
into it with incredible force.
This may also confuse the target.
rock-climb.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
rock-climb.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
rock-climb.name: Rock Climb

rock-polish.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This can sharply raise the Speed stat.
rock-polish.effect_long: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
rock-polish.effect_short: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.
rock-polish.name: Rock Polish

rock-slide.description:
Large boulders are hurled at the opposing
Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make
the opposing Pokémon flinch.
rock-slide.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
rock-slide.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
rock-slide.name: Rock Slide

rock-smash.description:
The user attacks with a punch.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
This move can also shatter rocks in the field.
rock-smash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
rock-smash.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.
rock-smash.name: Rock Smash

rock-throw.description:
The user picks up and throws a small
rock at the target to attack.
rock-throw.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
rock-throw.name: Rock Throw

rock-tomb.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also
lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing
its movement.
rock-tomb.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
rock-tomb.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
rock-tomb.name: Rock Tomb

rock-wrecker.description:
The user launches a huge boulder at the
target to attack.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
rock-wrecker.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
rock-wrecker.effect_short: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
rock-wrecker.name: Rock Wrecker

role-play.description:
The user mimics the target completely,
copying the target’s natural Ability.
role-play.effect_long:
User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower-gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance-change, trace, wonder-guard, or zen-mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
role-play.name: Role Play

rolling-kick.description:
The user lashes out with a quick, spinning
kick. This may also make the target flinch.
rolling-kick.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
rolling-kick.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
rolling-kick.name: Rolling Kick

rollout.description:
The user continually rolls into the target
over five turns. It becomes more powerful
each time it hits.
rollout.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense-curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
rollout.effect_short: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.
rollout.name: Rollout

roost.description:
The user lands and rests its body.
It restores the user’s HP by up to
half of its max HP.
roost.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.
roost.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
roost.name: Roost

rototiller.description:
Tilling the soil, the user makes it easier
for plants to grow. This raises the Attack
and Sp. Atk stats of Grass-type Pokémon.
rototiller.effect_long: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all grass Pokémon in battle.
rototiller.effect_short: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all grass Pokémon in battle.
rototiller.name: Rototiller

round.description:
The user attacks the target with a song.
Others can join in the Round and make
the attack do greater damage.
round.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.
round.effect_short: Has double power if it's used more than once per turn.
round.name: Round

sacred-fire.description:
The target is razed with a mystical fire
of great intensity. This may also leave the
target with a burn.
sacred-fire.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.
sacred-fire.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.  Lets frozen Pokémon thaw themselves.
sacred-fire.name: Sacred Fire

sacred-sword.description:
The user attacks by slicing with a long
horn. The target’s stat changes
don’t affect this attack’s damage.
sacred-sword.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation ignores the target's stat modifiers, including evasion.
sacred-sword.name: Sacred Sword

safeguard.description:
The user creates a protective field
that prevents status conditions
for five turns.
safeguard.effect_long:
Protects Pokémon on the user's side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal-dance, or thrash.
safeguard.effect_short: Protects the user's field from major status ailments and confusion for five turns.
safeguard.name: Safeguard

sand-attack.description:
Sand is hurled in the target’s face,
reducing the target’s accuracy.
sand-attack.effect_long: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
sand-attack.effect_short: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
sand-attack.name: Sand Attack

sand-tomb.description:
The user traps the target inside a harshly
raging sandstorm for four to five turns.
sand-tomb.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.
sand-tomb.effect_short: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
sand-tomb.name: Sand Tomb

sandstorm.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned
to hurt all combatants except the
Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
sandstorm.effect_long:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar-beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.
sandstorm.effect_short: Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.
sandstorm.name: Sandstorm

scald.description:
The user shoots boiling hot water at
its target. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
scald.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
scald.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
scald.name: Scald

scary-face.description:
The user frightens the target with a scary
face to harshly lower its Speed stat.
scary-face.effect_long: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
scary-face.effect_short: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
scary-face.name: Scary Face

scratch.description:
Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake
the target to inflict damage.
scratch.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
scratch.name: Scratch

screech.description:
An earsplitting screech harshly lowers
the target’s Defense stat.
screech.effect_long: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
screech.effect_short: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
screech.name: Screech

searing-shot.description:
The user torches everything around it
with an inferno of scarlet flames.
This may also leave those hit with a burn.
searing-shot.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
searing-shot.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
searing-shot.name: Searing Shot

secret-power.description:
The user attacks the target with a
secret power. Its additional effects vary
depending on the user’s environment.
secret-power.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyzes target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyzes target
Neon           | Paralyzes target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep
secret-power.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to inflict a status effect which depends upon the terrain.
secret-power.name: Secret Power

secret-sword.description:
The user cuts with its long horn. The odd
power contained in the horn does physical
damage to the target.
secret-sword.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.
secret-sword.effect_short: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
secret-sword.name: Secret Sword

seed-bomb.description:
The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled
seeds down on the target from above.
seed-bomb.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
seed-bomb.name: Seed Bomb

seed-flare.description:
The user emits a shock wave from
its body to attack its target. This may
also harshly lower the target’s Sp. Def.
seed-flare.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by two stages.
seed-flare.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by two stages.
seed-flare.name: Seed Flare

seismic-toss.description:
The target is thrown using the power of
gravity. It inflicts damage equal to
the user’s level.
seismic-toss.effect_long: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.
seismic-toss.effect_short: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.
seismic-toss.name: Seismic Toss

self-destruct.description:
The user attacks everything around it
by causing an explosion.
The user faints upon using this move.
self-destruct.effect_long: User faints, even if the attack fails or misses.  Inflicts regular damage.
self-destruct.name: Self-Destruct

shadow-ball.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the
target. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
shadow-ball.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
shadow-ball.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
shadow-ball.name: Shadow Ball

shadow-blast.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
shadow-blast.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
shadow-blast.name: Shadow Blast

shadow-blitz.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-blitz.name: Shadow Blitz

shadow-bolt.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
shadow-bolt.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
shadow-bolt.name: Shadow Bolt

shadow-break.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-break.name: Shadow Break

shadow-chill.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
shadow-chill.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to freeze the target.
shadow-chill.name: Shadow Chill

shadow-claw.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made
from shadows.
Critical hits land more easily.
shadow-claw.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
shadow-claw.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
shadow-claw.name: Shadow Claw

shadow-down.effect_long: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
shadow-down.effect_short: Lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
shadow-down.name: Shadow Down

shadow-end.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 of its current HP in recoil.
shadow-end.effect_short: User receives 1/2 its HP in recoil.
shadow-end.name: Shadow End

shadow-fire.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
shadow-fire.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
shadow-fire.name: Shadow Fire

shadow-force.description:
The user disappears, then strikes the
target on the next turn.
This move hits even if the target protects itself.
shadow-force.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User vanishes for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

This move ignores the effects of detect and protect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
shadow-force.effect_short: User vanishes, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.  Hits through Protect and Detect.
shadow-force.name: Shadow Force

shadow-half.effect_long: Halves HP of all Pokémon on the field.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
shadow-half.effect_short: Halves HP of all Pokémon on the field.  Must recharge
shadow-half.name: Shadow Half

shadow-hold.effect_long:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton-pass, u-turn, or a shed-shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton-pass.
shadow-hold.effect_short: Prevents the target from leaving battle.
shadow-hold.name: Shadow Hold

shadow-mist.effect_long: Lowers the target's evasion by two stages.
shadow-mist.effect_short: Lowers the target's evasion by two stages.
shadow-mist.name: Shadow Mist

shadow-punch.description:
The user throws a punch from the shadows.
This attack never misses.
shadow-punch.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
shadow-punch.name: Shadow Punch

shadow-rave.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-rave.name: Shadow Rave

shadow-rush.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move while in hyper mode.
shadow-rush.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit in Hyper Mode.
shadow-rush.name: Shadow Rush

shadow-shed.effect_long: Removes the effects of light-screen, reflect, and safeguard.
shadow-shed.effect_short: Removes Light Screen, Reflect, and Safeguard.
shadow-shed.name: Shadow Shed

shadow-sky.effect_long: Changes the weather to Shadow Sky for five turns.  Pokémon other than shadow Pokémon take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  This move is typeless for the purposes of weather-ball.
shadow-sky.effect_short: Changes the weather to Shadow Sky for five turns.
shadow-sky.name: Shadow Sky

shadow-sneak.description:
The user extends its shadow and attacks
the target from behind.
This move always goes first.
shadow-sneak.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-sneak.name: Shadow Sneak

shadow-storm.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-storm.name: Shadow Storm

shadow-wave.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
shadow-wave.name: Shadow Wave

sharpen.description:
The user lowers its polygon count to
make itself more jagged, raising the
Attack stat.
sharpen.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
sharpen.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack by one stage.
sharpen.name: Sharpen

sheer-cold.description:
The target is attacked with a blast of
absolute-zero cold. The target faints
instantly if this attack hits.
sheer-cold.effect_long:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
sheer-cold.name: Sheer Cold

shell-smash.description:
The user breaks its shell, which lowers
Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply
raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.
shell-smash.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by two stages each.  Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
shell-smash.effect_short: Raises user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by two stages.  Lower user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
shell-smash.name: Shell Smash

shift-gear.description:
The user rotates its gears, raising its
Attack and sharply raising its Speed.
shift-gear.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack by one stage and its Speed by two stages.
shift-gear.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack by one stage and its Speed by two stages.
shift-gear.name: Shift Gear

shock-wave.description:
The user strikes the target with a quick
jolt of electricity.
This attack never misses.
shock-wave.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
shock-wave.name: Shock Wave

signal-beam.description:
The user attacks with a sinister beam of
light. This may also confuse the target.
signal-beam.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
signal-beam.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
signal-beam.name: Signal Beam

silver-wind.description:
The target is attacked with powdery
scales blown by wind.
This may also raise all the user’s stats.
silver-wind.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.
silver-wind.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise all of the user's stats by one stage.
silver-wind.name: Silver Wind

simple-beam.description:
The user’s mysterious psychic wave
changes the target’s Ability to Simple.
simple-beam.effect_long: Changes the target's ability to simple.
simple-beam.effect_short: Changes the target's ability to Simple.
simple-beam.name: Simple Beam

sing.description:
A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming
voice that puts the target into a
deep slumber.
sing.name: Sing

sketch.description:
It enables the user to permanently learn
the move last used by the target.
Once used, Sketch disappears.
sketch.effect_long:
Permanently replaces itself with the target's last used move.  If that move is chatter or struggle, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mimic or mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.
sketch.effect_short: Permanently becomes the target's last used move.
sketch.name: Sketch

skill-swap.description:
The user employs its psychic power to
exchange Abilities with the target.
skill-swap.effect_long:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.
skill-swap.name: Skill Swap

skull-bash.description:
The user tucks in its head to raise its
Defense in the first turn, then
rams the target on the next turn.
skull-bash.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
skull-bash.effect_short: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.
skull-bash.name: Skull Bash

sky-attack.description:
A second-turn attack move where
critical hits land more easily.
This may also make the target flinch.
sky-attack.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.  Critical hit chance is one level higher than normal.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
sky-attack.effect_short: User charges for one turn before attacking.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
sky-attack.name: Sky Attack

sky-drop.description:
The user takes the target into the sky,
then drops it during the next turn.
The target cannot attack while in the sky.
sky-drop.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User carries the target high into the air for one turn, during which no moves will hit either Pokémon and neither can act.  On the following turn, the user drops the target, inflicting damage and ending the effect.

If the target is flying-type, this move will function as normal but inflict no damage.

gust, hurricane, sky-uppercut, smack-down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind can hit both the user and the target during this effect.  gust and twister will additionally have double power.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during this effect.

Either Pokémon may be hit during this effect if also under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

*Bug*: If gravity is used during a double or triple battle while this move is in effect, this move is not correctly canceled on the target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As this move prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.
sky-drop.effect_short: Carries the target high into the air, dodging all attacks against either, and drops it next turn.
sky-drop.name: Sky Drop

sky-uppercut.description:
The user attacks the target with an
uppercut thrown skyward with force.
sky-uppercut.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop.
sky-uppercut.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage and can hit Bounce and Fly users.
sky-uppercut.name: Sky Uppercut

slack-off.description:
The user slacks off, restoring its own HP
by up to half of its max HP.
slack-off.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.
slack-off.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
slack-off.name: Slack Off

slam.description:
The target is slammed with a long tail,
vines, or the like to inflict damage.
slam.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
slam.name: Slam

slash.description:
The target is attacked with a slash
of claws or blades.
Critical hits land more easily.
slash.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
slash.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
slash.name: Slash

sleep-powder.description:
The user scatters a big cloud
of sleep-inducing dust
around the target.
sleep-powder.name: Sleep Powder

sleep-talk.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses
one of the moves it knows.
sleep-talk.effect_long:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.
sleep-talk.effect_short: Randomly uses one of the user's other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.
sleep-talk.name: Sleep Talk

sludge.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target.
This may also poison the target.
sludge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge.name: Sludge

sludge-bomb.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target.
This may also poison the target.
sludge-bomb.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge-bomb.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge-bomb.name: Sludge Bomb

sludge-wave.description:
The user strikes everything around it
by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave.
This may also poison those hit.
sludge-wave.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge-wave.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
sludge-wave.name: Sludge Wave

smack-down.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile
to attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon
will fall to the ground when it’s hit.
smack-down.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet-rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.
smack-down.effect_short: Removes any immunity to Ground damage.
smack-down.name: Smack Down

smelling-salts.description:
This attack inflicts double damage on a
target with paralysis. This also cures the
target’s paralysis, however.
smelling-salts.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is paralyzed, this move has double power, and the target is cured of its paralysis.
smelling-salts.effect_short: If the target is paralyzed, inflicts double damage and cures the paralysis.
smelling-salts.name: Smelling Salts

smog.description:
The target is attacked with a
discharge of filthy gases.
This may also poison the target.
smog.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
smog.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
smog.name: Smog

smokescreen.description:
The user releases an obscuring cloud
of smoke or ink. This lowers the
target’s accuracy.
smokescreen.effect_long: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
smokescreen.effect_short: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.
smokescreen.name: Smokescreen

snarl.description:
The user yells as if it’s ranting about
something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stat
of opposing Pokémon.
snarl.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
snarl.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
snarl.name: Snarl

snatch.description:
The user steals the effects of any attempts
to use a healing or stat-changing move.
snatch.effect_long:
The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself.  Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag.

If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move's effect.

If the user steals psych-up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych-up.  If the user was the original target of psych-up, and the Pokémon that originally used it's affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
snatch.effect_short: Steals the target's move, if it's self-targeted.
snatch.name: Snatch

snore.description:
An attack that can be used only if the
user is asleep. The harsh noise may also
make the target flinch.
snore.effect_long: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
snore.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.  Only works if the user is sleeping.
snore.name: Snore

soak.description:
The user shoots a torrent of water
at the target and changes
the target’s type to Water.
soak.effect_long: Changes the target to pure water-type until it leaves the field.  If the target has multitype, this move will fail.
soak.effect_short: Changes the target's type to Water.
soak.name: Soak

soft-boiled.description:
The user restores its own HP
by up to half of its max HP.
May also be used in the field to heal HP.
soft-boiled.effect_long: Heals the user for half its max HP.
soft-boiled.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.
soft-boiled.name: Soft-Boiled

solar-beam.description:
A two-turn attack. The user gathers
light, then blasts a bundled beam on the
next turn.
solar-beam.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
solar-beam.effect_short: Requires a turn to charge before attacking.
solar-beam.name: Solar Beam

sonic-boom.description:
The target is hit with a destructive shock
wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.
sonic-boom.name: Sonic Boom

spacial-rend.description:
The user tears the target along with the
space around it.
Critical hits land more easily.
spacial-rend.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
spacial-rend.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
spacial-rend.name: Spacial Rend

spark.description:
The user throws an electrically charged
tackle at the target. This may also leave
the target with paralysis.
spark.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
spark.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
spark.name: Spark

spider-web.description:
The user ensnares the target with thin,
gooey silk so it can’t flee from battle.
spider-web.effect_long:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton-pass, u-turn, or a shed-shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton-pass.
spider-web.effect_short: Prevents the target from leaving battle.
spider-web.name: Spider Web

spike-cannon.description:
Sharp spikes are shot at the target
in rapid succession.
They hit two to five times in a row.
spike-cannon.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
spike-cannon.name: Spike Cannon

spikes.description:
The user lays a trap of spikes at the
opposing team’s feet. The trap hurts
Pokémon that switch into battle.
spikes.effect_long:
Scatters spikes around the opposing field, which damage opposing Pokémon that enter the field for 1/8 of their max HP.  Pokémon immune to ground moves are immune to this damage, except during gravity.  Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.

wonder-guard does not block damage from this effect.

rapid-spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.
spikes.effect_short: Scatters Spikes, hurting opposing Pokémon that switch in.
spikes.name: Spikes

spiky-shield.description:
In addition to protecting the user from attacks,
this move also damages any attacker who
makes direct contact.
spiky-shield.effect_long: Blocks damaging attacks and damages attacking Pokémon for 1/8 their max HP.
spiky-shield.effect_short: Blocks damaging attacks and damages attacking Pokémon for 1/8 their max HP.
spiky-shield.name: Spiky Shield

spit-up.description:
The power stored using the move Stockpile
is released at once in an attack. The more
power is stored, the greater the move’s power.
spit-up.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is equal to 100 times the amount of energy stored by stockpile.  Ignores the random factor in the damage formula.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.
spit-up.effect_short: Power is 100 times the amount of energy Stockpiled.
spit-up.name: Spit Up

spite.description:
The user unleashes its grudge on the move
last used by the target by cutting 4 PP
from it.
spite.effect_long: Lowers the PP of the target's last used move by 4.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.
spite.effect_short: Lowers the PP of the target's last used move by 4.
spite.name: Spite

splash.description:
The user just flops and splashes around
to no effect at all...
splash.effect_long:
Does nothing.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.
splash.name: Splash

spore.description:
The user scatters bursts of spores
that induce sleep.
spore.name: Spore

stealth-rock.description:
The user lays a trap of levitating stones
around the opposing team. The trap hurts
opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
stealth-rock.effect_long:
Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid-spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.
stealth-rock.effect_short: Causes damage when opposing Pokémon switch in.
stealth-rock.name: Stealth Rock

steam-eruption.description:
The user immerses the target in superheated steam.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
steam-eruption.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
steam-eruption.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn the target.
steam-eruption.name: Steam Eruption

steamroller.description:
The user crushes its targets by rolling
over them with its rolled-up body.
This may also make the target flinch.
steamroller.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.
steamroller.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
steamroller.name: Steamroller

steel-wing.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel.
This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
steel-wing.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage. Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.
steel-wing.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to raise the user's Defense by one stage.
steel-wing.name: Steel Wing

sticky-web.description:
The user weaves a sticky net around
the opposing team, which lowers their
Speed stat upon switching into battle.
sticky-web.effect_long:
Shoots a web over the opponents' side of the field, which lowers the Speed of any opposing Pokémon that enters the field by one stage.

Pokémon in the air, such as flying-types and those with levitate, are unaffected.  rapid-spin removes Sticky Web from the user's side of the field; defog removes it from both sides.
sticky-web.effect_short: Covers the opposing field, lowering opponents' Speed by one stage upon switching in.
sticky-web.name: Sticky Web

stockpile.description:
The user charges up power and raises
both its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
The move can be used three times.
stockpile.effect_long:
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.  Stores energy for use with spit-up and swallow.  Up to three levels of energy can be stored, and all are lost if the user leaves the field.  Energy is still stored even if the stat boosts cannot be applied.

If the user uses baton-pass, the stat boosts are passed as normal, but the stored energy is not.
stockpile.effect_short: Stores energy up to three times for use with Spit Up and Swallow.
stockpile.name: Stockpile

stomp.description:
The target is stomped with a big foot.
This may also make the target flinch.
stomp.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.
stomp.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
stomp.name: Stomp

stone-edge.description:
The user stabs the target with
sharpened stones from below.
Critical hits land more easily.
stone-edge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
stone-edge.effect_short: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
stone-edge.name: Stone Edge

stored-power.description:
The user attacks the target with stored
power. The more the user’s stats are
raised, the greater the move’s power.
stored-power.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power is increased by 100% its original value for every stage any of the user's stats have been raised.  Accuracy, evasion, and lowered stats do not affect this move's power.  For a Pokémon with all five stats modified to +6, this move's power is 31×.
stored-power.effect_short: Power is higher the more the user's stats have been raised, to a maximum of 31×.
stored-power.name: Stored Power

storm-throw.description:
The user strikes the target with a fierce
blow. This attack always results in a
critical hit.
storm-throw.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Always scores a critical hit.
storm-throw.name: Storm Throw

strength.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown
at maximum power. This can also be used
to move heavy boulders.
strength.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
strength.name: Strength

string-shot.description:
The opposing Pokémon are bound
with silk blown from the user’s mouth
that harshly lowers the Speed stat.
string-shot.effect_long: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
string-shot.effect_short: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
string-shot.name: String Shot

struggle.description:
An attack that is used in desperation
only if the user has no PP. This also
damages the user a little.
struggle.effect_long:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  User takes 1/4 its max HP in recoil.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

This move is used automatically when a Pokémon cannot use any other move legally, e.g., due to having no PP remaining or being under the effect of both encore and torment at the same time.

This move's recoil is not treated as recoil for the purposes of anything that affects recoil, such as the ability rock-head.  It also is not prevented by magic-guard.

This move cannot be copied by mimic, mirror-move, or sketch, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.
struggle.effect_short: User takes 1/4 its max HP in recoil.
struggle.name: Struggle

struggle-bug.description:
While resisting, the user attacks the
opposing Pokémon. This lowers the
Sp. Atk stat of those hit.
struggle-bug.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
struggle-bug.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.
struggle-bug.name: Struggle Bug

stun-spore.description:
The user scatters a cloud of numbing
powder that paralyzes the target.
stun-spore.name: Stun Spore

submission.description:
The user grabs the target and recklessly
dives for the ground. This also damages
the user a little.
submission.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
submission.effect_short: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
submission.name: Submission

substitute.description:
The user makes a copy of itself using
some of its HP.
The copy serves as the user’s decoy.
substitute.effect_long:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
substitute.effect_short: Transfers 1/4 of the user's max HP into a doll, protecting the user from further damage or status changes until it breaks.
substitute.name: Substitute

sucker-punch.description:
This move enables the user to attack
first. This move fails if the target is not
readying an attack.
sucker-punch.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has not selected a damaging move this turn, or if the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

This move is not affected by iron-fist.
sucker-punch.effect_short: Only works if the target is about to use a damaging move.
sucker-punch.name: Sucker Punch

sunny-day.description:
The user intensifies the sun
for five turns, powering up
Fire-type moves.
sunny-day.effect_long:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
sunny-day.effect_short: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.
sunny-day.name: Sunny Day

super-fang.description:
The user chomps hard on the
target with its sharp front fangs.
This cuts the target’s HP in half.
super-fang.effect_long: Inflicts typeless damage equal to half the target's remaining HP.
super-fang.effect_short: Inflicts damage equal to half the target's HP.
super-fang.name: Super Fang

superpower.description:
The user attacks the target with great
power. However, this also lowers the
user’s Attack and Defense stats.
superpower.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
superpower.effect_short: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage after inflicting damage.
superpower.name: Superpower

supersonic.description:
The user generates odd sound waves from
its body that confuse the target.
supersonic.name: Supersonic

surf.description:
The user attacks everything around it by
swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
This can also be used for crossing water.
surf.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.
surf.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage and can hit Dive users.
surf.name: Surf

swagger.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target.
However, this also sharply raises the
target’s Attack stat.
swagger.effect_long: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.
swagger.effect_short: Raises the target's Attack by two stages and confuses the target.
swagger.name: Swagger

swallow.description:
The power stored using the move Stockpile
is absorbed by the user to heal its HP.
Storing more power heals more HP.
swallow.effect_long: Heals the user depending on the amount of energy stored by stockpile: 1/4 its max HP after one use, 1/2 its max HP after two uses, or fully after three uses.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.
swallow.effect_short: Recovers 1/4 HP after one Stockpile, 1/2 HP after two Stockpiles, or full HP after three Stockpiles.
swallow.name: Swallow

sweet-kiss.description:
The user kisses the target with a sweet,
angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
sweet-kiss.name: Sweet Kiss

sweet-scent.description:
A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing
Pokémon’s evasiveness. This also lures wild
Pokémon if used in places such as tall grass.
sweet-scent.effect_long: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.
sweet-scent.effect_short: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.
sweet-scent.name: Sweet Scent

swift.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing
Pokémon. This attack never misses.
swift.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
swift.name: Swift

switcheroo.description:
The user trades held items with the target
faster than the eye can follow.
switcheroo.effect_long:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky-hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice-band, choice-scarf, or choice-specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
switcheroo.name: Switcheroo

swords-dance.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting
spirit. This sharply raises the user’s
Attack stat.
swords-dance.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.
swords-dance.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.
swords-dance.name: Swords Dance

synchronoise.description:
Using an odd shock wave, the user
inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same
type in the area around it.
synchronoise.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Only Pokémon that share a type with the user will take damage from this move.
synchronoise.effect_short: Hits any Pokémon that shares a type with the user.
synchronoise.name: Synchronoise

synthesis.description:
The user restores its own HP.
The amount of HP regained varies
with the weather.
synthesis.effect_long:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny-day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
synthesis.effect_short: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
synthesis.name: Synthesis

tackle.description:
A physical attack in which the user
charges and slams into the target
with its whole body.
tackle.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
tackle.name: Tackle

tail-glow.description:
The user stares at flashing lights to
focus its mind, drastically raising its
Sp. Atk stat.
tail-glow.effect_long: Raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.
tail-glow.effect_short: Raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.
tail-glow.name: Tail Glow

tail-slap.description:
The user attacks by striking the target
with its hard tail. It hits the target two
to five times in a row.
tail-slap.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
tail-slap.name: Tail Slap

tail-whip.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making
opposing Pokémon less wary and
lowering their Defense stat.
tail-whip.effect_long: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
tail-whip.effect_short: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
tail-whip.name: Tail Whip

tailwind.description:
The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind
that ups the Speed stat of the user and
its allies for four turns.
tailwind.effect_long: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.
tailwind.effect_short: For three turns, friendly Pokémon have doubled Speed.
tailwind.name: Tailwind

take-down.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for
slamming into the target.
This also damages the user a little.
take-down.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
take-down.effect_short: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
take-down.name: Take Down

taunt.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that
allows it to use only attack moves
for three turns.
taunt.effect_long:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, and sleep-talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal-burst, and mirror-coat are allowed.
taunt.effect_short: For the next few turns, the target can only use damaging moves.
taunt.name: Taunt

techno-blast.description:
The user fires a beam of light at
its target. The move’s type changes
depending on the Drive the user holds.
techno-blast.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is holding a plate or a drive, this move's type is the type corresponding to that item.

Note: This effect is technically shared by both techno-blast and judgment; however, Techno Blast is only affected by drives, and Judgment is only affected by plates.
techno-blast.effect_short: If the user is holding a appropriate plate or drive, the damage inflicted will match it.
techno-blast.name: Techno Blast

teeter-dance.description:
The user performs a wobbly dance that
confuses the Pokémon around it.
teeter-dance.name: Teeter Dance

telekinesis.description:
The user makes the target float with its
psychic power. The target is easier to
hit for three turns.
telekinesis.effect_long:
For three turns (including this one), moves used against the target have 100% accuracy, but the target is immune to ground damage.  Accuracy of one-hit KO moves is exempt from this effect.

This effect is removed by gravity.  If Gravity is already in effect, this move will fail.
telekinesis.effect_short: Moves have 100% accuracy against the target for three turns.
telekinesis.name: Telekinesis

teleport.description:
Use it to flee from any wild Pokémon.
It can also warp to the last Pokémon
Center visited.
teleport.effect_long: Does nothing.  Wild battles end immediately.
teleport.effect_short: Immediately ends wild battles.  No effect otherwise.
teleport.name: Teleport

thief.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s
held item simultaneously. The user can’t
steal anything if it already holds an item.
thief.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
thief.name: Thief

thousand-arrows.description:
This move also hits opposing Pokémon
that are in the air. Those Pokémon are
knocked down to the ground.
thousand-arrows.effect_long: This move has a unique effect, but it is unreleased, so the specific effect is unknown.
thousand-arrows.name: Thousand Arrows

thousand-waves.description:
The user attacks with a wave
that crawls along the ground.
Those hit can’t flee from battle.
thousand-waves.effect_long: This move has a unique effect, but it is unreleased, so the specific effect is unknown.
thousand-waves.name: Thousand Waves

thrash.description:
The user rampages and attacks
for two to three turns.
The user then becomes confused.
thrash.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.
thrash.effect_short: Hits every turn for 2-3 turns, then confuses the user.
thrash.name: Thrash

thunder.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped
on the target to inflict damage.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
thunder.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.

During rain-dance, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

During sunny-day, this move has 50% accuracy.
thunder.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunder.name: Thunder

thunder-fang.description:
The user bites with electrified fangs.
This may also make the target flinch or
leave it with paralysis.
thunder-fang.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target and a separate $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
thunder-fang.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target and a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
thunder-fang.name: Thunder Fang

thunder-punch.description:
The target is punched with an electrified
fist. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
thunder-punch.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunder-punch.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunder-punch.name: Thunder Punch

thunder-shock.description:
A jolt of electricity crashes down on
the target to inflict damage. This may
also leave the target with paralysis.
thunder-shock.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunder-shock.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunder-shock.name: Thunder Shock

thunder-wave.description:
The user launches a weak jolt
of electricity that paralyzes the target.
thunder-wave.name: Thunder Wave

thunderbolt.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on the
target. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
thunderbolt.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunderbolt.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
thunderbolt.name: Thunderbolt

tickle.description:
The user tickles the target into laughing,
reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
tickle.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.
tickle.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage.
tickle.name: Tickle

topsy-turvy.description:
All stat changes affecting the target
turn topsy-turvy and become the
opposite of what they were.
topsy-turvy.name: Topsy-Turvy

torment.description:
The user torments and enrages the
target, making it incapable of using
the same move twice in a row.
torment.effect_long:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice-band, choice-scarf, choice-specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn't use that move this turn.
torment.effect_short: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.
torment.name: Torment

toxic.description:
A move that leaves the target
badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
toxic.effect_long: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.
toxic.effect_short: Badly poisons the target, inflicting more damage every turn.
toxic.name: Toxic

toxic-spikes.description:
The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the
opposing team’s feet. They poison
