opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
toxic-spikes.effect_long:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid-spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton-pass are not affected by this effect.
toxic-spikes.effect_short: Scatters poisoned spikes, poisoning opposing Pokémon that switch in.
toxic-spikes.name: Toxic Spikes

transform.description:
The user transforms into a copy of the
target right down to having
the same move set.
transform.effect_long:
User copies the target's species, weight, type, ability, calculated stats (except HP), and moves.  Copied moves will all have 5 PP remaining.  IVs are copied for the purposes of hidden-power, but stats are not recalculated.

choice-band, choice-scarf, and choice-specs stay in effect, and the user must select a new move.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor forced by encore.
transform.effect_short: User becomes a copy of the target until it leaves battle.
transform.name: Transform

tri-attack.description:
The user strikes with a simultaneous
three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze,
or leave the target with paralysis.
tri-attack.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.  One of these effects is selected at random; they do not each have independent chances to occur.
tri-attack.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
tri-attack.name: Tri Attack

trick.description:
The user catches the target off guard
and swaps its held item with its own.
trick.effect_long:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky-hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice-band, choice-scarf, or choice-specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
trick.name: Trick

trick-or-treat.description:
The user takes the target trick-or-treating.
This adds Ghost type to the target’s type.
trick-or-treat.effect_long: Adds ghost to the target's types.
trick-or-treat.effect_short: Adds ghost to the target's types.
trick-or-treat.name: Trick-or-Treat

trick-room.description:
The user creates a bizarre area in which
slower Pokémon get to move first for
five turns.
trick-room.effect_long:
For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.

Pokémon holding full-incense, lagging-tail, or quick-claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.
trick-room.effect_short: For five turns, slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.
trick-room.name: Trick Room

triple-kick.description:
A consecutive three-kick attack that
becomes more powerful with each
successive hit.
triple-kick.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits three times in the same turn.  The second hit has double power, and the third hit has triple power.  Each hit has a separate accuracy check, and this move stops if a hit misses.

skill-link does not apply.
triple-kick.effect_short: Hits three times, increasing power by 100% with each successful hit.
triple-kick.name: Triple Kick

trump-card.description:
The fewer PP this move has,
the greater its power.
trump-card.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is determined by the PP remaining for this move, after its PP cost is deducted.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

PP remaining | Power
------------ | ----:
4 or more    |    40
3            |    50
2            |    60
1            |    80
0            |   200

If this move is activated by another move, the activating move's PP is used to calculate power.
trump-card.effect_short: Power increases when this move has less PP, up to a maximum of 200.
trump-card.name: Trump Card

twineedle.description:
The user damages the target twice in
succession by jabbing it with two spikes.
This may also poison the target.
twineedle.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Hits twice in the same turn.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
twineedle.effect_short: Hits twice in the same turn.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to poison the target.
twineedle.name: Twineedle

twister.description:
The user whips up a vicious tornado
to tear at the opposing Pokémon.
This may also make them flinch.
twister.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.
twister.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
twister.name: Twister

u-turn.description:
After making its attack, the user
rushes back to switch places with
a party Pokémon in waiting.
u-turn.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.
u-turn.effect_short: User must switch out after attacking.
u-turn.name: U-turn

uproar.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for
three turns. During that time,
no one can fall asleep.
uproar.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.
uproar.effect_short: Forced to use this move for several turns.  Pokémon cannot fall asleep in that time.
uproar.name: Uproar

v-create.description:
With a hot flame on its forehead, the user
hurls itself at its target. This lowers the
user’s Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
v-create.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.
v-create.effect_short: Lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.
v-create.name: V-create

vacuum-wave.description:
The user whirls its fists to send a wave
of pure vacuum at the target.
This move always goes first.
vacuum-wave.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
vacuum-wave.name: Vacuum Wave

venom-drench.description:
Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd
poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack,
Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
venom-drench.effect_long: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by one stage if it is poisoned.
venom-drench.effect_short: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by one stage if it is poisoned.
venom-drench.name: Venom Drench

venoshock.description:
The user drenches the target in a special
poisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled
if the target is poisoned.
venoshock.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.
venoshock.effect_short: Inflicts double damage if the target is Poisoned.
venoshock.name: Venoshock

vice-grip.description:
The target is gripped and squeezed from
both sides to inflict damage.
vice-grip.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
vice-grip.name: Vice Grip

vine-whip.description:
The target is struck with slender,
whiplike vines to inflict damage.
vine-whip.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
vine-whip.name: Vine Whip

vital-throw.description:
The user attacks last. In return, this throw
move never misses.
vital-throw.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
vital-throw.name: Vital Throw

volt-switch.description:
After making its attack, the user
rushes back to switch places with
a party Pokémon in waiting.
volt-switch.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.
volt-switch.effect_short: User must switch out after attacking.
volt-switch.name: Volt Switch

volt-tackle.description:
The user electrifies itself, then charges.
This also damages the user quite a lot.
This may leave the target with paralysis.
volt-tackle.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
volt-tackle.effect_short: User takes 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
volt-tackle.name: Volt Tackle

wake-up-slap.description:
This attack inflicts big damage on a
sleeping target. This also wakes the target
up, however.
wake-up-slap.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is sleeping, this move has double power, and the target wakes up.
wake-up-slap.effect_short: If the target is asleep, has double power and wakes it up.
wake-up-slap.name: Wake-Up Slap

water-gun.description:
The target is blasted with a
forceful shot of water.
water-gun.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
water-gun.name: Water Gun

water-pledge.description:
A column of water strikes the target. When
combined with its fire equivalent, the
damage increases and a rainbow appears.
water-pledge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a friendly Pokémon used grass-pledge earlier this turn, all opposing Pokémon have halved Speed for four turns (including this one).
water-pledge.effect_short: With Grass Pledge, halves opposing Pokémon's Speed for four turns.
water-pledge.name: Water Pledge

water-pulse.description:
The user attacks the target with
a pulsing blast of water.
This may also confuse the target.
water-pulse.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
water-pulse.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to confuse the target.
water-pulse.name: Water Pulse

water-shuriken.description:
The user hits the target with throwing
stars two to five times in a row.
This move always goes first.
water-shuriken.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
water-shuriken.name: Water Shuriken

water-sport.description:
The user soaks itself with water.
This weakens Fire-type moves
for five turns.
water-sport.effect_long: fire moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
water-sport.name: Water Sport

water-spout.description:
The user spouts water to damage opposing
Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP,
the lower the move’s power.
water-spout.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the user's remaining HP and is given by `150 * HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 150 when the user has full HP.
water-spout.effect_short: Inflicts more damage when the user has more HP remaining, with a maximum of 150 power.
water-spout.name: Water Spout

waterfall.description:
The user charges at the target and may make it
flinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.
waterfall.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
waterfall.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
waterfall.name: Waterfall

weather-ball.description:
An attack move that varies in power and
type depending on the weather.
weather-ball.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  If a weather move is active, this move has double power, and its type becomes the type of the weather move.  shadow-sky is typeless for the purposes of this move.
weather-ball.effect_short: If there be weather, this move has doubled power and the weather's type.
weather-ball.name: Weather Ball

whirlpool.description:
The user traps the target in a violent swirling
whirlpool for four to five turns.
whirlpool.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.
whirlpool.effect_short: Prevents the target from leaving battle and inflicts 1/16 its max HP in damage for 2-5 turns.
whirlpool.name: Whirlpool

whirlwind.description:
The target is blown away, and a different
Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild,
this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
whirlwind.effect_long:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.
whirlwind.effect_short: Immediately ends wild battles.  Forces trainers to switch Pokémon.
whirlwind.name: Whirlwind

wide-guard.description:
The user and its allies are protected from
wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
wide-guard.effect_long:
Moves with multiple targets will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
wide-guard.effect_short: Prevents any multi-target moves from hitting friendly Pokémon this turn.
wide-guard.name: Wide Guard

wild-charge.description:
The user shrouds itself in electricity
and smashes into its target.
This also damages the user a little.
wild-charge.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
wild-charge.effect_short: User receives 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
wild-charge.name: Wild Charge

will-o-wisp.description:
The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white
flame at the target to inflict a burn.
will-o-wisp.name: Will-O-Wisp

wing-attack.description:
The target is struck with large, imposing
wings spread wide to inflict damage.
wing-attack.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
wing-attack.name: Wing Attack

wish.description:
One turn after this move is used,
the target’s HP is restored by
half the user’s max HP.
wish.effect_long: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user's max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.
wish.effect_short: User will recover half its max HP at the end of the next turn.
wish.name: Wish

withdraw.description:
The user withdraws its body into its hard
shell, raising its Defense stat.
withdraw.effect_long: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.
withdraw.effect_short: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.
withdraw.name: Withdraw

wonder-room.description:
The user creates a bizarre area in which
Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def
stats are swapped for five turns.
wonder-room.effect_long: For five turns (including this one), every Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense are swapped.
wonder-room.effect_short: All Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense are swapped for 5 turns.
wonder-room.name: Wonder Room

wood-hammer.description:
The user slams its rugged body into the
target to attack. This also damages
the user quite a lot.
wood-hammer.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.
wood-hammer.effect_short: User receives 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.
wood-hammer.name: Wood Hammer

work-up.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack
and Sp. Atk stats increase.
work-up.effect_long: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
work-up.effect_short: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
work-up.name: Work Up

worry-seed.description:
A seed that causes worry is planted on
the target. It prevents sleep by making
the target’s Ability Insomnia.
worry-seed.effect_long:
Changes the target's ability to insomnia.

If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.
worry-seed.effect_short: Changes the target's ability to Insomnia.
worry-seed.name: Worry Seed

wrap.description:
A long body or vines are used to wrap and
squeeze the target for four to five turns.
wrap.effect_long:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.
wrap.effect_short: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
wrap.name: Wrap

wring-out.description:
The user powerfully wrings the target.
The more HP the target has, the greater
the move’s power.
wring-out.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Power directly relates to the target's relative remaining HP, given by `1 + 120 * current HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 121.
wring-out.effect_short: Power increases against targets with more HP remaining, up to a maximum of 121 power.
wring-out.name: Wring Out

x-scissor.description:
The user slashes at the target by
crossing its scythes or claws as if
they were a pair of scissors.
x-scissor.effect_short: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
x-scissor.name: X-Scissor

yawn.description:
The user lets loose a huge yawn that
lulls the target into falling asleep
on the next turn.
yawn.effect_long:
Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital-spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.
yawn.effect_short: Target sleeps at the end of the next turn.
yawn.name: Yawn

zap-cannon.description:
The user fires an electric blast like a
cannon to inflict damage and
cause paralysis.
zap-cannon.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
zap-cannon.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target.
zap-cannon.name: Zap Cannon

zen-headbutt.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head
and attacks the target.
This may also make the target flinch.
zen-headbutt.effect_long: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
zen-headbutt.effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to make the target flinch.
zen-headbutt.name: Zen Headbutt
